summary:
Combined to my academic and university studies, the gained work experience I cumulated through the years has extensively contributed to a lifetime project based on ethics, responsibility, respect for diversity and difference and mutual understanding.

I have always shwon a keen interest in lifetime and continual learning which is, I assume, a source of personal development, a strong tool to face change and adopt new challenges.
These principles have proved to be effective in the projects and the contributions I had:

- Project Management and Team building,
- Process optimization  and improvement,
- Work place organization and rengineering,
- Factual approach to decision making process,
- Standard work and procedures building.

Event Approach and Tools used: 6S, Ishikawa Diagram (Cause-Effect Diagram), Decision Matrices, Brainstorming, Value Stream Analysis, workplace optimisation, spaghetti diagrams, visual process controls, etc Data & Facilities Required for Event •	Asset Register •	ES Inventory register •	Workshop equipment maintenance records & procedures •	Workshop current procedures & QHSE statistics •	Number of employees •	Future plans – equipment & market •	Any service quality related measurements of any form if existing (e.g. No of ES complaints etc.) •	Layout diagram of the work shop & offices •	Projector, screen & access to M-I SWACO network & Printer •	Room for planning & discussions •	Marker Pens •	Spray-paint (to mark scrap objects) •	Plastic Document sleeves (to protect Red Tags) •	Tie wraps •	NOBO board & easel •	Area for red tagged objects •	Paint & brushes •	Shovels & yard brushes •	PPE •	Fork Lift Truck or other suitable lifting machines', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lyes', 'last_name': 'A.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Quality Management and Continuous Improvement'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Wayne', 'last_name': 'Skelton-Church', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Director'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Nadir', 'last_name': 'Ouadfel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Superviseur de solidification  chez Oil Recovery Services'}]}, {'title': 'Transportation Management and Optimization', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': 'Elaborating a Business case to support management in making decision if investment in vacuum trucks is required. Better utilization of trucks: less waiting, improved on-time delivery through better transportation management. Improved Logistics including: fewer delays, less waiting, fewer transportation miles for similar volumes', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lyes', 'last_name': 'A.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Quality Management and Continuous Improvement'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Greg', 'last_name': 'Lane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lean Business Development, Lean Leadership      Including High Mix & Low Volume Organizations'}]}, {'title': 'Inventory Management and Improvement', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': 'Reduce inventory levels for finished barite to a maximum of 2000 big bags while maintaining 100% customer fulfillment rate. Eliminate any spare parts shortage for 2011 Event Scope: Traditional Manufacturing Value Stream Mapping of Barite Mill. Introduction of Total Productive Maintenance for manufacturing processes and an inventory improvement. Review of forecasting tools & inventory management principles Objectives: •	Value Stream Map the Barite Mill process •	Introduce CI manufacturing tools (SMED, 5S, Standardized Work, Operator Balance, Andon, etc.) based on opportunities identified during mapping • Implementation of Total Productive Maintenance Methodologies to improve Overall Equipment Effectiveness. •	Improved inventory forecasting of the need for ore and improve methods to maintain a precise safety level of finished Barite', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Lyes', 'last_name': 'A.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Quality Management and Continuous Improvement'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Greg', 'last_name': 'Lane', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lean Business Development, Lean Leadership      Including High Mix & Low Volume Organizations'}]}]

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': 12732, 'name': 'M-I SWACO', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQH5752-8frJbQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856238227?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=PJQ98oBjd96nuop7RRfgtUcvGqdOv4w6ycRHqbGspuc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/m-i-swaco/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2002}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hassi Messaoud, Algeria', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'M-I SWACO', 'description': "- Local quality leader, lead Quality meetings and be a key member of location Quality Steering Committee, 
- Responsible for leading the Quality investigations and effective Remedy Work Plans,
- Leading location Quality self-assessments by creating effective implementation Plans,
- Ensuring compliance with segment's and company's quality standards, processes and procedures, 
- Preparing, updating and raising necessary quality documents and procedures as needed,
- Assisting with the coaching and development of new Quality and CI Lean Project Leaders, 
- A Clear focus on location processes, optimizing initiatives everywhere possible. 
- Implementing and monitoring the Quality Management System under ISO 9001:2008 standard,
- Leading internal and external Quality audits, communicating the results and setting up the Remedy Work Plans,
- Initiating, leading and monitoring Continuous Improvement and Lean projects,
- Leading Kaizen and 5S events and workshops,
- Translation of legal and procedural documents from French into English and vice versa.", 'title': 'Quality Coordinator and CI Lean Champion', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Hassi Messaoud, Algeria', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'M-I SWACO', 'description': '- Maintaining and improving a common suite of integrated management procedures that are applied as required across the diverse range of business activities. 
- Guiding and assisting business processes and support units to develop standard operating procedures and associated documentation that address business specific needs.
- Establishing business focused guidelines for management review; ensuring that these are applied at divisional level, and consolidating divisional risks, information and activities into a complete and global programme. 
- Providing and maintaining a competent and effective internal audit function through coordination with internal and third party resources. Coordinating the internal (quality audit) programme 
- Alerting divisions to risk of ISO certification non compliance and the reviewing the suitability of preventive and corrective action plans. 
- Independently verifying the completion and effectiveness of preventive and corrective action plans. 
- Coordinating effective arrangements with the external certification body. 
- Verifying the effectiveness of measures introduced to identify and address risks to product and service quality identified through audit and management review.
- Ensuring that lessons learned from internal and external quality audits are captured and addressed for the benefit of the whole organization. 
- Defining on-going management system training and development requirements for user and management staff.
